text: Triggering of the T-cell receptor - CD3 complex activates two major signal cascades in T lymphocytes , ( i ) Ca2+ - dependent signal cascades and ( ii ) protein kinase cascades .

Both signal cascades contribute to the induction of the <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene during T-cell activation .

text: Prominent protein kinase cascades are those that activate mitogen - activated protein ( MAP ) kinases .

We show here that <extra_id_0> c-Raf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is at the helm of the classic MAP-Erk cascade , contributes to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction through a distal enhancer element spanning the nucleotides from positions -502 to -413 in front of the transcriptional start site of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

Induction of this distal <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhancer differs from induction of the proximal <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter-enhancer , since it is induced by phorbol esters alone and independent from Ca2+ signals .
